title: Analyst Interview
Application Type: I interviewed at McLeod Health
Interview Descriptions: There was short turn around for the offer to interview and the dates available. I did not get the job but, apparently neither did the other candidates. This was allegedly due to undergoing a management changeover and continuing with the hiring process.
Interview Questions: I was asked about problem solving methods in a difficult / challenging environment.

title: Registered Nurse Interview
Application Type: I applied online. I interviewed at McLeod Health
Interview Descriptions: Easy process, recieved phone call. Went in person to interview with department manager with standard interview questions. Was set up with employee health and orientation the next week and began hiring processes.
Interview Questions: Where do I see myself in 5 years

title: Accountant I Interview
Application Type: I applied online. I interviewed at McLeod Health
Interview Descriptions: I was called by HR for an interview about two weeks after I put in my application. I ent in for an interview and was offered the job two weeks later.
Interview Questions: What is your biggest weakness?

title: Maintenance Technician Interview
Application Type: I applied online. The process took 2 weeks. I interviewed at McLeod Health (Columbia, SC) in Jan 2021
Interview Descriptions: the interview went very smoothly and the managers made it easy to communicate. every one was very friendly and willing to answer all the questions i had. i would recommend this job for others.
Interview Questions: what did you learn in school

title: Recruiter Interview
Application Type: I interviewed at McLeod Health
Interview Descriptions: The interview process was an easy process. The questions were fair and valid. I did have several interviews. First being with my recruiter and then it opened up to other directors and managers. Overall, a very good experience. I am happy with the outcome.
Interview Questions: Where do you see yourself in five years.

title: Administrative/Clerical Interview
Application Type: I applied online. I interviewed at McLeod Health (Little River, SC) in Nov 2020
Interview Descriptions: Professional, yet laid back. Made me feel as if I was already a part of the team. They allow you to ask questions and just get to know each other’s personalities.
Interview Questions: Discuss a time you worked with a team member who was difficult to work with and how did you handle it?

title: Patient Care Technician Interview
Application Type: I applied online. The process took 5 weeks. I interviewed at McLeod Health (Florence, SC) in Sept 2020
Interview Descriptions: It was a long process that took about a month, It was a a phone interview that landed in me getting hired where I had to do a back ground check and many other steps, I then got my tag.
Interview Questions: What is my previous occupation

title: Registered Nurse Interview
Application Type: I applied through a recruiter. I interviewed at McLeod Health (Florence, SC) in Mar 2020
Interview Descriptions: Very to the point, not difficult. More questions about yourself and your goals and what would you do situations. They were professional and not overwhelming or intimidating.  Gave a your of the floor and were very interested in learning about you and what you wanted to gain from your experience and career.
Interview Questions: If you had an issue with a patient or upset family member, how would you handle/approach it?

title: Coding Specialist Interview
Application Type: I applied online. The process took 2 weeks. I interviewed at McLeod Health (Florence, SC) in Oct 2019
Interview Descriptions: It was easy the basic questions you can find online. You interview with the director and a manager. They describe to you the job and what your day will be like .
Interview Questions: Tell me about yourself. What do you know about coding?

title: Emergency Department Technician Interview
Application Type: I applied in-person. The process took 3 weeks. I interviewed at McLeod Health (Florence, SC) in Oct 2019
Interview Descriptions: Typical "why do you think you'll be a good fit for this position" type of questions. Basic and generic questions on how you would be a prizable asset to the company.
Interview Questions: How do you think you'll contribute to the workplace?

title: Resident Interview
Application Type: I interviewed at McLeod Health
Interview Descriptions: Great. Very accomodating. Really its just a meet and great as long as you don't have red flags on your application.  Simple process. Everyone was nice. Its better if you do an AI first and everyone likes you. Be able to handle at least 5 pts or they will think you are weak when rounding.
Interview Questions: What brings you to mcleod? pretty standard stuff

title: Medical Assistant Interview
Application Type: I applied online. I interviewed at McLeod Health
Interview Descriptions: The interview process was great. I interviewed back when they had a manager at every office so they weren’t so stressed all the time.  I felt really comfortable and welcomed. The process may be more tense now that a lot of things have changed.
Interview Questions: Why would you like to work for McLeod?

title: Patient Account Representative Interview
Application Type: I applied online. I interviewed at McLeod Health (Florence, SC) in Jul 2019
Interview Descriptions: I filled out application and was called for interview in less than a week.  I just had the interview today so I have not been hired yet.  The interview consisted of the typical questions. I interviewed with 2 people at once.
Interview Questions: What are your weakness?

title: Nurse Extern Interview
Application Type: I applied online. The process took 4 days. I interviewed at McLeod Health (Florence, SC) in Dec 2018
Interview Descriptions: Met with management. Answered a few typical interview questions. They opened the floor for me to ask questions, which I had thought about before the interview. All of this opened the door to natural conversation to take place.
Interview Questions: What are some ways that I have served my community?

title: Medical Surgical Tech/Nursing Assistant Interview
Application Type: I applied online. The process took 1 week. I interviewed at McLeod Health (Florence, SC) in Aug 2018
Interview Descriptions:
From the time I applied to the position to the interview, it was a quick process. I applied to the job on Tuesday & received a phone call that Friday morning to schedule an interview for the following Monday. The interview was formal, quick, and brief. The staff was very nice and welcoming. I interviewed the department manager/RN. She was very nice & advised me they would be able to work with my school schedule. I also came in the next morning (Tuesday) for job shadowing. It was an overall great experience. I have yet to receive an offer so I’m still waiting. She stated I should hear something by the end of the week or the following Monday. 

Will update if there’s an offer


Update: I received an offer on 8/31/18 (shortly after posting this review)
Interview Questions: Tell me about yourself.

title: Robotics Coordinator Interview
Application Type: I applied through a recruiter. The process took 4 weeks. I interviewed at McLeod Health (Florence, SC) in Feb 2018
Interview Descriptions: I was contacted by one of their recruiters to see if I would be interested in a position they were creating.  After several phone calls and emails, I went to Florence to meet with the Surgical Dept leadership to go over this position.
Interview Questions: How does data drive change in the process of efficiency for robotic surgery?

title: Floor Tech Interview
Application Type: I applied online. I interviewed at McLeod Health (Florence, SC) in Oct 2017
Interview Descriptions: I met with the assistant administrator and we talked about the job detail.The interview was great.We went over the job description and the material I would using.Everyone was nice to me and very helpful getting  started with the job
Interview Questions: Can I be on time.

title: Scheduler Billing Representative and Patirnt Registration Interview
Application Type: I applied online. The process took 2 weeks. I interviewed at McLeod Health (Florence, SC) in Aug 2017
Interview Descriptions: The interview was intense. Three people firing  questions at you ;Some made no sense or had nothing to do wih the jobs. If they did a one one interview it would have been less intimidating.
Interview Questions: Why do you want to work here

title: Help Desk Analyst Interview
Application Type: I applied online. I interviewed at McLeod Health in Mar 2017
Interview Descriptions: Quick. Just a conversation to see if you're the right fit. Its been a couple of years, so I don't remember much else about it. I have to type at least thirty words.
Interview Questions: What do you like to do in your spare time?

title: Rad Tech Interview
Application Type: I applied online. The process took 2 weeks. I interviewed at McLeod Health
Interview Descriptions: It was a panel interview where each person asked a scenario questions. On a separate day you meet with staff and they evaluate you on what they think about you. First impression sort of thing.
Interview Questions: scenario questions

title: Long Term Contract Health Care and Administrative Consultant Interview
Application Type: I applied through a recruiter. The process took 1 day. I interviewed at McLeod Health (Florence, SC) in Jul 2016
Interview Descriptions: the recruiter knew very little about the job.  He showed no interest in marketing the position.  He had no information about the job and did not understand requirements of the job.  He must have been thrown into the job?
Interview Questions:
would I be willing to take a contract position with little notice?  Do I know what I would be doing?  

Do I have any experience?

title: Admission Register Interview
Application Type: I applied in-person. The process took 1 day. I interviewed at McLeod Health (Florence, SC) in Feb 2016
Interview Descriptions: On the day of the interview, dress appropriately and arrive early, calm and mentally prepared. Bring a list of references if you did not already include them in the resume you submitted. And, most importantly, don’t forget to relax and be yourself.
Interview Questions:
Can you tell me a little about yourself?
Why do you want this job?
What are your greatest professional strengths?
Why should we hire you?

title: Labor and Delivery Nurse Interview
Application Type: I applied online. The process took 2 weeks. I interviewed at McLeod Health (Myrtle Beach, SC) in Jul 2015
Interview Descriptions: I thought the hiring is easy. I called the chief nursing officer and she said they need nurses at Loris really bad. But I was wrong! I was interviewed by the whoever she is at the Labor and Delivery/nursery department in Loris and she turned me down in the end. At the beginning she asked me tons and tons of checklist question and she gave me in details the salary and the routine and she even tour me at the area I am expecting me to work. After the discussion, she said wait for two weeks! And two weeks later, none! No phone calls or anything. She just gave me a false reassurance. This stupid interview just waste my time. I knew McLeod Loris is one of the worst hospital in the area. They don't value people who are eager to work and now they are complaining they are having shortage of nurses.
Interview Questions: She asked me if I can read the contraction monitor for laboring mothers

title: Medical Interview
Application Type: I applied online. The process took 6 months. I interviewed at McLeod Health (Myrtle Beach, SC) in Feb 2015
Interview Descriptions: Very easy laid back, no pressure.  Took a tour of the hospital.  Met all key personnel.  The other issue was time to hire as well.  It was 6 moths of waiting.
Interview Questions: Describe a challenge you went through and how to fix it?

title: Laundry Interview
Application Type: I applied online. I interviewed at McLeod Health (Florence, SC) in Mar 2014
Interview Descriptions: The interview process is very quick, you  will speak with the director and explain your background, and how will you become a benefit for the company. You will also complete a walk through of the work location meeting all of the employees.
Interview Questions: How do you overcome stress?

title: Patient Care Coordinator Interview
Application Type: I applied online. The process took 2 weeks. I interviewed at McLeod Health in Jan 2014
Interview Descriptions: Overall interview was very professional, the interviewers provided great feedback to all my questions. They made me fell welcome very quickly. Their kindness allowed me to open up and speak freely without any stress. The process did not take long, I applied online, received e-mail from the hr dept, then received a phone call, had to provide all documentation and references, then came the interview. One day later I received a phone call and was offered a job with a great company.
Interview Questions: General knowledge questions

title: Programmer Analyst Interview
Application Type: I applied online. I interviewed at McLeod Health (Florence, SC) in Aug 2013
Interview Descriptions: HR will contact you if you make the cut, you when then be setup with an interview time. You report to HR and they take you over to the interview.
Interview Questions: What type of software development experience do you have.

title: Licensed Practical Nurse Interview
Application Type: I applied through an employee referral. The process took 1 week. I interviewed at McLeod Health (Florence, SC) in May 2012
Interview Descriptions: Lots of questions asked regarding knowledge of area applying for. Asked about my family. Asked about my previous job. Where did I see myself in 5 years? Do I plan to advance my nursing degree.
Interview Questions: What hours are you available to work?
